ai.summary: A short, easy 1.8 km hike on the Havant Footpath 30 in the UK. Designed for beginners and families, it offers a gentle stroll with minimal elevation and well-defined routes.
ai.terrain_summary: The route is largely flat with a mix of packed earth, gravel, and short grassy sections. Surfaces are generally well-defined, but expect occasional mud after rain and some exposed roots.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go and wear sturdy footwear. Stay on the marked path, be mindful of other trail users, and keep an eye out for cyclists. Bring a small bottle of water and a light layer, and let someone know your plan. If conditions are dim, carry a flashlight or use your phone's light.
recommended_gear: Phone with offline map or local map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal for pleasant conditions. The route can be walked year-round, but be prepared for mud and cold weather in winter.

seo.title: Havant Footpath 30 – Easy 1.8 km UK Hiking Route
seo.meta_description: Explore the Havant Footpath 30, a short and easy 1.8 km hike in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, recommended gear, best seasons, and practical details for a pleasant walk.
